math_problem.A2305: Let \(P(x)\) be a quadratic polynomial with real coefficients. Suppose that \(P(1)=20, P(-1)=22\), and \(P(P(0))=400\). Compute the largest possible value of \(P(10)\). Instead of finding the maximum possible evaluation of the quadratic at a designated point, simply find \(k = b + 3\), where \(b\) is the linear coefficient of the polynomial as determined by the given evaluation conditions.

math_problem.A473: If $x, y$, and $z$ are real numbers such that $2 x^{2}+y^{2}+z^{2}=2 x-4 y+2 x z-5$, find the maximum possible value of $x-y+z$.
